query:
90. Consider the following statements :
1. Recently, all the countries of the
United Nations have adopted the
first-ever compact for international
migration, the 'Global Compact
for Safe, Orderly and Regular
Migration (GCM)'.
2. The objectives and commitments.
stated in the GCM are binding on
the UN member countries.
3. The GCM addresses internal
migration or internally displaced
people also in its objectives and
commitments.
How many of the above statements are
correct?
(a) Only one
(b) Only two
(c) All three
(d) None

solution_notes.summary: The question asks to evaluate the correctness of three statements regarding the Global Compact for Safe, Orderly and Regular Migration (GCM). The GCM is the first international compact on migration adopted by the UN, but not all countries have adopted it. Also, the objectives and commitments are non-binding. The GCM does not address internal migration.

sections.title: Overview of the Global Compact for Migration (GCM)

content.text: The Global Compact for Safe, Orderly and Regular Migration (GCM) is the first comprehensive international agreement on migration.
It was adopted on December 10, 2018, at an intergovernmental conference in Marrakech, Morocco.
The GCM is not legally binding; it is a cooperative framework.
The New York Declaration for Refugees and Migrants in September 2016 paved the way for the GCM.

sections.slide_layout: Title slide with key points about the GCM’s background and purpose.

assessment_questions.concept_to_be_assessed: Understanding the background, purpose, and legal status of the Global Compact for Migration.

sections.title: Adoption and Endorsement by UN Member States

content.text: The GCM was endorsed by the UN General Assembly on December 19, 2018, with 152 countries voting in favor.
Five countries voted against the compact: the United States, Hungary, Israel, Poland, and the Czech Republic.
Therefore, not all countries of the United Nations have adopted the GCM.

sections.slide_layout: List the countries that voted for, against, and abstained from the GCM.

assessment_questions.concept_to_be_assessed: Understanding which countries supported, opposed, or abstained from the GCM.

sections.title: Objectives, Commitments, and Scope of the GCM

content.text: The GCM outlines 23 objectives to improve migration management.
These objectives aim to minimize adverse drivers of migration, protect migrants' rights, and enhance pathways for regular migration.
The commitments in the GCM are not legally binding on UN member countries.
The GCM focuses on international migration and does not address internal migration or internally displaced people.

sections.slide_layout: Explain the objectives, commitments, and the scope (international vs. internal migration) of the GCM.

assessment_questions.concept_to_be_assessed: Distinguishing the GCM's focus on international migration and its non-binding commitments.

sections.title: Analysis of the Statements

content.text: Statement 1 is incorrect because not all UN countries adopted the GCM.
Statement 2 is incorrect because the GCM's objectives and commitments are non-binding.
Statement 3 is incorrect because the GCM does not address internal migration.
Therefore, none of the statements are correct.

sections.slide_layout: Analyze each statement and conclude whether it's correct or incorrect based on the GCM details.

assessment_questions.concept_to_be_assessed: Evaluating the correctness of given statements based on the understanding of the GCM.

correct_answer_descriptions: None of the provided statements accurately describe the Global Compact for Migration.

accuracy_through_sources: UN official documents on the Global Compact for Migration
Reports from the International Organization for Migration (IOM)
UN General Assembly Resolutions related to migration
accuracy_proof: Statement 1: The UN documentation shows that not all member states adopted the GCM, as some voted against or abstained.
Statement 2: The GCM is explicitly defined as a non-binding, cooperative framework.
Statement 3: The GCM's scope is limited to international migration, as stated in its objectives and principles.
missing_content: Specific national action plans developed by countries to implement the GCM's objectives are not covered.
